meanings.definition: A person who holds possession of land or property.
meanings.sent1: The seisors of the house were responsible for its upkeep.
meanings.sent2: The seisors of the farm worked hard to maintain the land.
meanings.sent3: The seisors of the castle had to deal with a mischievous ghost.
meanings.sent4: She was the seisors of the secret garden, tending to its every need.
meanings.sent5: The seisors of the treasure chest guarded it with great care.

meanings.definition: The act of taking possession or control of something.
meanings.sent1: The seisors of the stolen goods were caught by the police.
meanings.sent2: The seisors of the company made important decisions for its future.
meanings.sent3: The seisors of the remote control fought over what to watch on TV.
meanings.sent4: The seisors of the playground equipment ensured it was used safely.
meanings.sent5: The seisors of the lost puppy were happy to reunite it with its owner.
